intro: Pilosella cymosiformis, commonly known as the clustered pearly everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are surrounded by fluffy, white bracts, giving it a soft, cloud-like appearance. Pilosella cymosiformis typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
